intro: Trichilia lovettii, commonly known as the African sandalwood, is a tropical tree native to regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes many species known for their aromatic wood. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and the tree can grow up to 20 meters tall. Due to its valuable timber and ecological importance, it is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
